info: All standard gems and libraries in a single file, constructed from the other JSON files (see rake task for details).

gems.description: Finds the shortest unique abbreviation amongst many strings

Encodes and decodes strings to a [Base64](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Base64) representation. Implemented as a small wrapper around [String#unpack](https://idiosyncratic-ruby.com/4-what-the-pack.html)
Benchmark utility: Measures and reports the time used to execute code
Support for arbitrary-precision floating point decimal arithmetic
[Bundler](https://bundler.io) is the local package manager for Ruby applications
Support for CGI ([Common Gateway Interface](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Common_Gateway_Interface))
gems.notes: Only the escape utilities are implemented as native extension.

gems.description: Trigonometric and transcendental functions for complex numbers
Adds the [goto](https://idiosyncratic-ruby.com/24-goto-fail.html)-like [Kernel#callcc](https://ruby-doc.org/core/Kernel.html#method-i-callcc)
Measures [code coverage](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Code_coverage)
Support for CSV ([Comma-separated Values](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comma-separated_values))
The [Date](https://rubyapi.org/o/date) and [DateTime](https://rubyapi.org/o/datetime) classes
Support for [DBM databases](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DBM_(computing))
Command-line [debugger](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Debugger)
gems.notes: This gem, which is bundled with Ruby 3.1 and later, is a new debugger that supersedes the [old debug](https://ruby-doc.org/stdlib/libdoc-3.0.2/debug/rdoc/DEBUGGER__.html) standard library/gem

gems.description: Provides three ways to [delegate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Delegation_pattern) method calls
Patches error messages to suggest correct spelling of methods/classes/variables
gems.notes: - You can [prevent Ruby from loading this default gem](https://idiosyncratic-ruby.com/71-nothing-to-disable.html) with `$ ruby --disable-did_you_mean`

gems.description: Provides common [hash functions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hash_function) like MD5, SHA1, SHA2, or RIPEMD-160
Distributed object system for Ruby
Abstraction around exception handling
[Readable aliases for special global variables](https://idiosyncratic-ruby.com/9-globalization.html)
Templating engine for Ruby
Improves error messages with additional debug info
gems.notes: - You can [prevent Ruby from loading this default gem with](https://idiosyncratic-ruby.com/71-nothing-to-disable.html) `$ ruby --disable-error_highlight`

gems.description: Access UNIX info from `/etc`

Loads values from the OS' `fcntl.h` to be used for low-level [file descriptor manipulation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File_descriptor) system calls with [IO#fcntl](https://ruby-doc.org/core/IO.html#method-i-fcntl) and [IO.sysopen](https://ruby-doc.org/core/IO.html#method-c-sysopen)
Support for FFI ([Foreign Function Interface](https://sourceware.org/libffi/))
gems.notes: Starting with Ruby 3.2, libffi is not bundled with Ruby anymore

gems.description: Utilities for working with the file system, such as copying, moving, or deleting files
Finds all files in a given directory and its sub-directories
gems.notes: You can get a very similar result using: ```find .`.split($/)``

gems.description: Provides a way to [delegate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Delegation_pattern) method calls. Also see [this overview of delegation in Ruby](http://radar.oreilly.com/2014/02/delegation-patterns-in-ruby.html), which contains an example
Support for [GDBM databases](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dbm)
[GNU getopt_long()](https://linux.die.net/man/3/getopt_long) style command-line option parsing
Patches `IO` for simple and portable access to the console
gems.notes: There is also the old [GitHub repo](https://github.com/nobu/io-console), but it is out of sync.

gems.description: Allows to work with `IO` streams in a non-blocking way
Adds methods to wait until an `IO` stream becomes readable or writable
[IP address](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IP_address) manipulation (IPv4 and IPv6)
Interactive Ruby Console ([REPL](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Read%E2%80%93eval%E2%80%93print_loop))
Support for JSON ([JavaScript Object Notation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JSON))
gems.notes: - Latest Ruby releases for 2.4 / 2.5 / 2.6 / 2.7 contain a security fix (CVE-2020-16255) not included in the listed gem versions

gems.description: [Logging utility](https://ruby.janlelis.de/50-exploring-the-stdlib-logger)
gems.notes:
- **Attention:** There was a 1.2.8 version on rubygems, which was later [yanked](https://rubygems.org/gems/logger/versions/1.2.8)
- The old repository is at [github.com/nahi/logger](https://github.com/nahi/logger)

gems.description: Support for [matrices](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Matrix_%28mathematics%29)
Test/spec framework, comes with mocking and benchmark capabilities
Generates [Makefiles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Makefile) for native [C extensions](https://github.com/ruby/ruby/blob/master/doc/extension.rdoc)
[Monitors](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monitor_%28synchronization%29) for multi-threaded code
A mixin that makes any object behave like a [mutex](https://ruby-doc.org/core/Mutex.html)
Support for FTP ([File Transfer Protocol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File_Transfer_Protocol))
Support for HTTP ([Hypertext Transfer Protocol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypertext_Transfer_Protocol))
Support for IMAP ([Internet Message Access Protocol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internet_Message_Access_Protocol))
Support for POP3 ([Post Office Protocol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Post_Office_Protocol))
Internal class for the other net-* libraries
Support for SMTP ([Simple Mail Transfer Protocol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Simple_Mail_Transfer_Protocol))
Support for [Telnet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Telnet)
[Kanji](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kanji) encoding converter. Can also be used via the [Kconv.kconv method](https://github.com/ruby/nkf/blob/master/lib/kconv.rb).
Adds more statistics methods to `ObjectSpace`. Since Ruby 3.1, it also includes the `objspace/trace` debug utility.
Implementation of the [observer pattern](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Observer_pattern), a way to let interested other objects know o an objetc's updates
Monkeypatches [Kernel#open](https://ruby-doc.org/core/Kernel.html#method-i-open) to support remote endpoints via `net/http` and `net/ftp`
Simple spawning of child processes
Wraps [OpenSSL](https://www.openssl.org/) for cryptographic functionality
gems.notes: JRuby uses the Bouncy Castle-based [jruby-openssl gem](https://github.com/jruby/jruby-openssl) instead

gems.description: Command-line option parser
Wrapper around [Hash](https://ruby-doc.org/core/Hash.html) which lets you read and set attributes with a method-based API
Wraps `File`, `FileTest`, `Dir`, and `FileUtils` to ease working with file system paths
Debug tool that displays intermediate results of a method chain
The `pp` print debugging helper via `require 'pp'`. It will format the result object in more readable way.
Better object formatting and inspection. Also see the [pp gem](/pp/).
Access to prime numbers and prime factorization
Prism is a portable, error tolerant, and maintainable recursive descent parser for the Ruby language
Transactional file storage for Ruby objects
Support for YAML ([YAML Ain't Markup Language](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/YAML))
gems.notes: Starting with Ruby 3.2, libyaml is not bundled with Ruby anymore

gems.description: Manages [pseudo terminals](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pseudo_terminal). Also includes the [IO#expect method](https://ruby-doc.org/stdlib-3.0.2/libdoc/pty/rdoc/IO.html#method-i-expect) via `require 'expect'`, which can be used to wait for a specific pattern to be read.
Bindings for Racc, a [YACC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yacc)-like [LALR(1) parser generator](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LALR_parser_generator)
A Ruby task runner, inspired by [make](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Make_%28software%29)
`RbConfig` is a [Ruby constant that contains compile time information](https://idiosyncratic-ruby.com/42-ruby-config.html)
Released with Ruby 3.0, RBS is a way to declare types in Ruby. The gem allows parsing and processing type definitions written in RBS.
Ruby documentation generator
If available, [readline-ext](https://stdgems.org/readline-ext) will be loaded, or (Ruby-only) [reline](https://stdgems.org/reline) will be used.
Interface to [GNU Readline](https://directory.fsf.org/wiki/Readline) and [NetBSD Editline](https://thrysoee.dk/editline/)
gems.notes:
- Was just called **readline** before Ruby 2.7
- JRuby uses the jline-based [jruby-readline gem](https://github.com/jruby/jruby-readline) instead

gems.description: Ruby-only implementation of [GNU Readline](https://directory.fsf.org/wiki/Readline) / [NetBSD Editline](https://thrysoee.dk/editline/)
Thread-aware [DNS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Domain_Name_System) resolver
Will replace [Socket](https://ruby-doc.org/stdlib/libdoc/socket/rdoc/Socket.html)'s DNS with [resolv](https://stdgems.org/resolv)
Support for XML ([Extensible Markup Language](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/XML))
Support fot the [Linda distributed computing paradigm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linda_%28coordination_language%29) in [drb](https://ruby-doc.org/stdlib/libdoc/drb/rdoc/index.html)
Ruby parser that creates a [symbolic expression tree](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S-expression)
Support for RSS ([Rich Site Summary](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RSS)) and [Atom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atom_%28standard%29)
A shim gemspec to indicate that the Ruby implementation includes the `ruby2_keywords` method
gems.notes: Although `ruby2_keywords` is introduced as a default gem in Ruby 3.1, the `ruby2_keywords` method is available on earlier Ruby versions. See [the announcement](https://www.ruby-lang.org/en/news/2019/12/12/separation-of-positional-and-keyword-arguments-in-ruby-3-0/) and [this blog post](https://eregon.me/blog/2021/02/13/correct-delegation-in-ruby-2-27-3.html) for information about how to use this feature.

gems.description: [RubyGems](https://rubygems.org) allows you to download, install, and use Ruby software packages on your system
gems.notes: - You can [prevent Ruby from loading RubyGems (and any gems)](https://idiosyncratic-ruby.com/71-nothing-to-disable.html) with `$ ruby --disable-gems`

gems.description: Pure-Ruby [scanf](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scanf_format_string) implementation
Support for [SDBM databases](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dbm)
Provides crpytographical randomness from openssl or the OS
Data structure for unordered collections without duplicates. Implemented on top of Hash.
gems.notes:
- Although this default gem is not automatically required, it will be autoloaded as soon you use the `Set` constant or the `to_set` method (Ruby 3.2+)
-Prior to v1.0.0, this gem included the SortedSet class (now exctracted to the [sorted_set gem](https://github.com/knu/sorted_set))

gems.description: Provides a Ruby interface for interacting with the [shell](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bourne_shell)
Escape and manipulate commads to be run in the [shell](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bourne_shell)
Mixin for Ruby classes that should only have one instance
Support for [unix-](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_domain_socket) and [network sockets](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Network_socket)
Makes strings behave like IO objects
Lexical string scanning
[Two-phase lock](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Two-phase_locking) with a counter for multi-threaded code
Assists with code recommendation to resolve Ruby syntax errors
Interface to the low-level [syslog](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syslog) logger
Simplifies OS independent creation of temporary files
A xUnit family unit testing framework (compatibility layer for minitest)
Waits for threads to finish
Adds more methods to `Time`
Auto-terminates code blocks after the time limit is reached
Adds a `Dir.mktmpdir` method for creating temporary directories OS independently
Outputs the [code execution trace](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tracing_%28software%29) via [Kernel#set_trace_func](https://ruby-doc.org/core/Kernel.html#method-i-set_trace_func)

Topological sorting using [Tarjan’s algorithm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tarjan%27s_strongly_connected_components_algorithm), which finds [strongly connected components](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strongly_connected_component) in [graphs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Graph_%28abstract_data_type%29)
Released with Ruby 3.0, typeprof allows you to [automatically generate RBS type annotations](https://github.com/ruby/typeprof/blob/master/doc/doc.md)
[Utilities to replace common UNIX commands](https://idiosyncratic-ruby.com/6-run-ruby-run.html)
Adds a [String#unicode_normalize](https://rubyapi.org/o/string#method-i-unicode_normalize) method which [normalizes unicode strings](https://unicode.org/reports/tr15/)
[URI](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uniform_resource_identifier)/URL manipulation
Explicitly allow objects to be garbage collected
HTTP Server
gems.notes: **Please note:** Despite the gemspec stating otherwise, the webrick version included with Ruby might be more recent than version 1.4.2. For example, the webrick included in Ruby 2.6.5, 2.5.7, 2.4.9, and 2.4.8 does include security fixes for CVE-2019-16201 and CVE-2019-16254.

gems.description: Let's you use Windows APIs, e.g. call functions in DLLs
Windows [OLE automation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OLE_Automation) interface
[Remote Procedure Calls via XML and HTTP](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/XML-RPC)

`require 'yaml'` will load the [psych default gem](https://stdgems.org/psych/), **yaml/dbm** is a wrapper around [DBM](https://stdgems.org/dbm/) using YAML serialization, and **yaml/store** lets you use [pstore](https://stdgems.org/pstore/) with YAML
Interface to the [zlib compression library](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zlib)
